alert.note: Alert for Anderson; Nelson; Spencer (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 1:53PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Spencer, northeastern Nelson and west central Anderson Counties through 230 PM EDT... At 152 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles southeast of Taylorsville, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds around 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Spencer, northeastern Nelson and west central Anderson Counties, including the following locations... Glensboro, Van Buren, Sparrow, Wayside, Drydock and Klondyke. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 700 PM EDT for central Kentucky.
